pmp_api.collectiondoc package¶

Submodules¶

pmp_api.collectiondoc.navigabledoc module¶

class pmp_api.collectiondoc.navigabledoc.NavigableDoc(collection_result)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

items[source]¶

All items listed in the collectiondoc.

links[source]¶

All links listed in the collectiondoc.

options(rel_type)[source]¶

Returns dictionary of query_options for particular query type. Raises Exception if rel_type is not found.

query(rel_type, params=None)[source]¶

Returns constructed url with query parameters for urn type requested. To see which params are expected first run query_template(rel_type).

Raises BadQuery if params are not valid.

Args:
rel_type – urn type we want to query
Kwargs:
params – dict of param values
query_types()[source]¶

Returns generator of query_types offered by the endpoint.

querylinks[source]¶

All items associated with query key of links

template(rel_type)[source]¶

Query_template for particular query type. Raises Exception if rel_type is not found.

pmp_api.collectiondoc.pager module¶

The Pager class is for easily following navigation elements returned by collection+doc.json documents.

class pmp_api.collectiondoc.pager.Pager[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

The Pager object is for keeping track of navigation values from a PMP Hypermedia object.

Usage:

 >>> from pmp_api.pmp_client import Pager
 >>> import requests
 >>> nav_page = requests.get("http://some-api.that-returns.json")
 >>> results = nav_page.json()
 >>> pager = Pager(results)
 >>> pager.navigable
 True
 >>> pager._next
"http://some-api.that-returns.json/some-next-page-of-results"
navigator(navigable_dict)[source]¶

Returns navigable_dictionary object which can be searched against common navigation values in order to populate class attributes.

Parameters:navigable_dict (dict) – dicitionary of JSON values
update(result_dict)[source]¶

Updates all page attributes as well as :attribute::navigable boolean attribute.

Parameters:result_dict – dictionary (from JSON)

pmp_api.collectiondoc.query module¶

pmp_api.collectiondoc.query.bad_params(template, var_dict)[source]¶

Returns dictionary of parameters that do not pass validation.

pmp_api.collectiondoc.query.make_query(template, params=None)[source]¶

Uses a uri-template and supplied params in order to create a valid endpoint request.

Raises BadQuery on invalid parameters.

pmp_api.collectiondoc.query.validate(template, var_dict)[source]¶

Returns True/False Tests whether a given dictionary var_dict is valid for a particular uri-template.
